thread.title: Weather warnings: Storm Ewan hits UK with 70mph winds | Daily Star
thread.title_full: Weather warnings: Storm Ewan hits UK with 70mph winds | Daily Star

author: Joshua Nevett
title: Weather warnings: Storm Ewan hits UK with 70mph winds | Daily Star
text:
WARNINGS: The Met Office has issued alerts across the UK “Sunday will be a wet and windy day in the UK.” Chief Meteorologist Eddy Carroll 
Elsewhere a bus carrying dozens of passengers was overturned by powerful winds, leaving at least five people injured. 
Gusts of almost 100mph caused extensive disruption on transport networks and severe damage to buildings across the UK. 
Now the Met Office has forecast more stormy conditions and snow to batter Britain throughout the next week to March 8. Storm Doris smashes Britain Storm Doris is causing disruption across the UK today 1 / 22 
Spring officially starts on Wednesday – but leading forecasters The Weather Company warned of another big chill in early March . 
Two months of colder-than-average conditions for March and April have been forecast. 
The Met Office forecast a cold snap ahead in midweek with snow in the North on higher ground. 
Government forecasters said a “more prolonged cold spell” with snow threatens more widely in Britain from mid-March. 
A Met Office forecaster said: “It will turn colder in the week with wintry showers in the North. 
“In early March, frontal systems will bring wet weather at times, with snow over northern hills, being rather cold at times in the North. The South could see temperatures a little above average. 
“From March 11 to 25, there will probably be spells of wet and windy weather at first. There is the possibility of a more prolonged cold spell, with an increased chance of snow, more likely later in the period.” Related articles
